text:
Abu Ibrahim al-Hashimi al-Qurashi (born October 1976,; alternative transliterations al-Qurayshi and al-Quraishi) is the second and current leader of the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant.
In January 2020, media reported his true identity is Amir Mohammed Abdul Rahman al-Mawli al-Salbi (). His appointment by a shura council was announced by ISIL media on 31 October 2019, less than a week after the death of Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi.
The U.S. Rewards for Justice Program offers up to $10 million reward to information that brings him to justice.

annotations.surface_form: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant
